venue.name: Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD)

item.description:
Francesco Pierfederici's Pycon talk touched briefly on simulations in Python, whetting our appetite for more detailed information. Francesco will talk more in-depth about discrete event simulations with SimPy:

Abstract
I will introduce SimPy (http://simpy.sourcefo..., a Python framework for discrete-event simulations. I will describe the framework itself and its main components. I will then walk you through a simple but non-trivial simulation to explain how SimPy is used in practice. You can also read the wikipedia page on discrete event simulations (http://en.wikipedia.o...) for some background info.



Last month's lightning talks were a big hit. We'll probably have time for one or two more: send me your ideas!



Free-form chilling starts at 6:30, formal activities at 7:00. Pizza will be provided by Microsoft!
item.name: Discrete Event Simulations Made Easy, plus more lightning talks?
